question: Which of the following attended all the three Round Table Conferences?
explanation: It was Dr. Ambedkar who attended all the three Round Table Conferences in London and forcefully argued for the welfare of the “untouchables”. The British Government decided to hold provincial elections in 1937. Dr. B.R. Ambedkar set up the “Independent Labore Party” in August 1936 to contest the elections in the Bombay province. He and many candidates of his party were elected to the Bombay Legislative Assembly.
